title: Build issue with intel-mpi for cmake packages
body:
I have noticed that cmake packages like `gromacs +mpi` and `lammps +mpi` fails to build with intel-mpi and intel-parallel-studio. The error message is:
```
-- Could NOT find MPI_C (missing: MPI_C_LIB_NAMES MPI_C_HEADER_DIR MPI_C_WORKS)
-- Could NOT find MPI_CXX (missing: MPI_CXX_LIB_NAMES MPI_CXX_HEADER_DIR MPI_CXX_WORKS)
CMake Error at  /apps/cmake/3.12.3-intel-17.0.1-liieoeh/share/cmake-3.12/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:137 (message):
  Could NOT find MPI (missing: MPI_C_FOUND MPI_CXX_FOUND)
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /apps/cmake/3.12.3-intel-17.0.1-liieoeh/share/cmake-3.12/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:378 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  /apps/cmake/3.12.3-intel-17.0.1-liieoeh/share/cmake-3.12/Modules/FindMPI.cmake:1666 (find_package_handle_standard_args)
  CMakeLists.txt:52 (find_package)
```
Error messages are similar for both gromacs and lammps and it goes away if I explicitly set the following in the package files
```
options.append('-DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=%s' % self.spec['mpi'].mpicc)
options.append('-DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=%s' % self.spec['mpi'].mpicxx)
```

I am trying the following spec:
```
lammps@20170901%intel@17.0.1~asphere~body build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~class2~colloid~compress~coreshell~dipole~granular~kspace~latte+lib~manybody~mc~meam~misc~molecule+mpi~mpiio patches=16f91dc30ea6ffba6ca6757f1414d51ef03ab4de7ff5b79f4f897be728ccca54 ~peri~poems~python~qeq~reax~replica~rigid~shock~snap~srd~user-atc~user-h5md~user-lb~user-misc~user-netcdf~user-omp~voronoi arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
    ^cmake@3.12.3%intel@17.0.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs patches=dd3a40d4d92f6b2158b87d6fb354c277947c776424aa03f6dc8096cf3135f5d0 ~qt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^ncurses@6.1%intel@17.0.1~symlinks~termlib arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^pkgconf@1.4.2%intel@17.0.1 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^openssl@1.0.2o%intel@17.0.1+systemcerts arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^perl@5.26.2%intel@17.0.1+cpanm patches=0eac10ed90aeb0459ad8851f88081d439a4e41978e586ec743069e8b059370ac +shared+threads arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
                ^gdbm@1.14.1%intel@17.0.1 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
                    ^readline@7.0%intel@17.0.1 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^zlib@1.2.11%intel@17.0.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
    ^intel-mpi@2017.1.132%intel@17.0.1 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

`intel@17.0.1` is provided by package `intel-parallel-studio@cluster.2017.1~mpi`.

Not sure if this is an issue with cmake or how `intel-parallel-studio and intel-mpi` environments are set for these packages. I would prefer not to hack the `package.py` files if possible. 

Please advise.
